doc.title: Drilling metrics surge in July
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Australia Diversified Industrial Commercial Services Dry July no more floodgate opens for exploration but can it continu_2025-08-29

passages.text: Exploration metrics for July echo IMD's commentary around continuation of momentum from the June quarter into July and August. Accordingly, exploration could surprise on the upside. This is encouraging for IMD and ALS Commodities with revenues being highly correlated. With IMD seeing steady momentum, we think potentially ALS could see a step change in sample flows in the next 3- 6 months. Having said all of this, industry feedback (i.e., drillers and other industry participants) continues to be mixed, highlighting ongoing uncertainty. Accordingly, we remain cautious on the timing of a meaningful recovery.

Drilling metrics stepped up in July - In July, drilling metrics have trended higher. This, alongside elevated junior raisings in recent months, does suggest that the industry could be approaching an inflexion point with exploration upcycle commencing at some point. IMD's commentary this month is also encouraging to say the least. However, industry feedback continues to remain mixed with majority of industry participants suggesting volatility could persist up to >9- 12 months.

Does June qtr indicate a turning point for IMD? - IMD's revenue in the June quarter surprised on the upside with \(19\%\) QoQ growth. There has been some conjecture around the sale of equipment in 4Q driving majority of that delta, but we argue this is not the case; it was driven by both ARPU and volumes, which are tied to activity levels and premiumisation. This could indicate a sign of things to come for IMD, but we think it is too early to turn positive especially considering industry feedback as well as potentially heightened capex and D&A profiles suppressing EPS growth trajectory.

Perhaps a step change could be on the cards for ALS - Over \(70\%\) of ALS's Minerals revenue comes from exploration. IMD's commentary and recent exploration metrics and junior raisings may indicate an imminent step change. However, even if exploration levels remain volatile, we think ALS's top line is likely to be resilient. This should be underpinned by its increased focus on expanding its mine site production testing, along with High- Performance Methods testing and appetite for more tests.

Compared to June, exploration projects in July have stepped up by \(30\%\) to 277 driven by gold, copper and lead- zinc. In terms of regional breakdown, the sequential uplift is primarily driven by Australia (+21), Canada (+17) and Mexico (+9). On a pcp basis, the total number of exploration projects has stepped up by \(28\%\) on pcp in July. We highlight that the number of exploration projects in July is still \(3\%\) lower than the average project count for July in the last 5 years (i.e., from CY20 through to CY24). Further, the number of projects in July is \(3\%\) and \(26\%\) lower than CY23 and CY22 monthly averages, respectively. On a 3- month rolling average basis, exploration projects have stepped up by \(17\%\) yoy and are \(10\%\) higher compared to June.

We are encouraged by the sharp sequential uplift in exploration projects given it is driven by two of the largest mining markets globally (i.e., Australia and Canada). This, along with substantial step up in junior raisings in recent months, points towards improved sentiments across the industry. However, given industry headwinds including elevated mine development costs, geopolitical concerns and fluid tariff saga have not abated, we still think it is too soon to conclude the commencement of an upcycle. Further, industry feedback continues to point to flat activity levels over the next 9- 12 months. Accordingly, we maintain our cautious stance around exploration for now.
Figure 1. Exploration projects up \(28\%\) on pcp...
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro
Figure 2. ... and 3mth rolling average up \(17\%\) on pcp
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro

The total number of reported drillholes has increased by \(33\%\) sequentially to 6,425 in July. On a pcp basis, the number of drillholes in July represents a \(61\%\) uplift. With this sequential surge, we highlight the July drillhole count is now \(44\%\) and \(10\%\) higher than monthly averages of CY23 and CY22, respectively.

While the strong sequential improvement in July appears encouraging, it remains to be seen whether it can be sustained in the coming months. The current momentum is primarily driven by majors and intermediates given juniors are yet to deploy meaningfully to exploration. IMD has noted that juniors typically make up

\(40\%\) of exploration market spend. Juniors have been raising at elevated levels in recent months, but timing of deployment could still be stretched out meaning drilling metrics could remain volatile for some more time. Given this, we continue to see downside risk to IMD's FY26 earnings expectation. As for ALS, its increasing exposure to mine site testing and High-Performance Methods (largely used by majors) should support resilience in earnings. Further, our industry feedback has noted that more tests are being done per site on average now than previously given increasing concerns around cost of mine development despite supportive commodity prices.
Figure 3. Drillholes up \(61\%\) compared to pcp
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro

We think interval metres, alongside number of exploration projects and drillholes, provide an insight into overall exploration drilling activity across the globe. Interval metres in July have come in at 13,911m, up \(16\%\) on pcp and are \(38\%\) higher compared to June. On a 3- month rolling average basis, interval metres have increased by \(18\%\) yoy and are up \(10\%\) sequentially.
Figure 4. Interval metres up \(16\%\) vs. pcp...
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro
Figure 5. ... and on a 3mth rolling avg basis, up \(18\%\) on pcp
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro

Uplift in gold and copperIn July, gold projects have tracked 52% higher on pcp, while copper projects stepped up by 8% on pcp. Compared to June, gold projects have increased by 33% and copper is up 24%. We highlight that IMD's commodity exposure to gold and copper stand at \(\sim 50\%\) and \(\sim 20 - 25\%\) , respectively. Accordingly, we think this sequential improvement in gold and copper projects could be positive for instrumentation volume growth, as well as demand for drilling fluids for IMD.
Figure 6. Gold projects up 52% YoY in July...
Figure 7... while copper is up 8% vs. pcp
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro

Step up in projects with significant intervalsExploration projects with significant intervals have come in at 147 in July, which is 10% higher on pcp, and 32% higher compared to June. On a 3- month rolling average basis, this has stepped up by 3% yoy, representing an uplift of 5% sequentially on June. Gold projects with significant intervals in July are 20% higher yoy, and up 25% vs June, while copper has been flat yoy but up 26% vs June.
Figure 8. Projects with significant intervals \(+10\%\) yoy...
Figure 9... driven by gold
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro
\(①\) 2025 Citigroup Inc. No redistribution without Citigroup's written permission. Source: Citi Research, S&P Capital IQ Pro

Founded as Campbell Brothers in 1863, ALS is headquartered in Brisbane and provides TIC services across a wide array of industries including, but not limited to, resources, industrial, pharmaceutical, food, environment and life sciences.
We have a Buy rating on ALS. Our bullish view on ALS is premised on:

- Global footprint of hub and spoke network provides resilience and flexibility;- Diversification into High-Performance Method and downstream activities continue to add to ALS's resilience through the cycle; and- Life Sciences TAM forecast to grow at an elevated pace and ALS is well positioned to benefit, particularly with respect to Environmental given its market-leading position in the sector.
Our 12-month target price of A\(19.45/sh is based on the average of our DCF and SOTP valuations.

- DCF valuation of A\(19.87/sh based on WACC of 9.8% with equity beta of 1.1 and a real terminal growth of 3.5%; and- SOTP valuation of A\)19.00/sh with \~19x EV/EBIT applied to our 12mth forward EBIT forecast. For Commodities, we have applied a premium to the average multiple of both ALS's global and domestic peers to reflect improving topline and margin resilience from diversification.
Key downside risks to our positive view and achieving our target price include:

- Sustained downturn in exploration with further step down from current levels;- Regulatory risks;- Highly competitive market particularly with respect to Life Sciences; and- Risks associated with FX exposure.

Headquartered in Balcatta, WA, IMD is a global mining technology company that provides commodity agnostic solutions to its customer base comprising of drilling contractors and resources companies. These solutions enable accurate, efficient and high- speed exploration and real- time analysis of orebodies, as well as extraction. It has a global footprint operating in all key mining regions.

We rate IMD a Neutral. We see challenges with respect to: (1) uncertainty around pace of recovery in exploration; (2) further delay in the meaningful increase in topline contribution from mining production; and (3) volatility in commodity prices and junior raisings. These factors are balanced by IMD's resilience, driven by its comprehensive suite of offerings, roll- out of bundled solutions and realisation of cross- selling opportunities.
Our target price of A\(3.55/sh on IMD is based on the average of DCF and sum- of- the- parts (SOTP) valuation methodologies:

- DCF valuation - A\(3.55/sh based on a beta of 0.9 and WACC of 9.7%. 
- SOTP valuation - A\(3.55/sh based on a \sim 13x EV/EBITDA multiple applied to our 12-month forward EBITDA forecast. The selected multiple is based on a discount to the historical average multiple of IMD's more comparable domestic peers (market cap weighted) given IMD's high exposure to exploration.
Key risks to achieving our target price include:

If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be more negative than we anticipate, the stock will likely have difficulty achieving our financial and price targets. Likewise, if any of these factors proves to have less of an effect than we anticipate, the stock could materially outperform our target.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "—" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
